name: Dwarves
background:
Dwarves are short humanoids who have developed advanced steam-powered technology and runic magic. They wear heavy armour and rely on powerful ranged weapons to make up for their slow speed. 

The Dwarves dwell in the ruins of their old holds scattered through the mountains of Tyria. During the Havoc Wars, Orc tribes attacked their homes and subjugated their people while the Dwarf armies were campaigning. The Dwarves hoped their allies would rescue them, but help never came. Now they have returned to their holds and barred the doors to outsiders, determined to never allow themselves to be conquered again.
backgroundFull:
The Dwarven tribes were once spread throughout Tyria, but as the plains were settled by humanity and Orcs came to the grasslands, the Dwarves retreated into the mountains. They made their homes in their mountains, creating powerful fortresses surrounded by terrace farms on the heights, and dug mines deep below. For most of their history, Dwarves had to travel overland, often through hostile territory, to visit and trade with other Dwarfholds. They began to experiment with ways to travel safely, until they discovered powered flight, and their helicopter convoys became a common sight between the mountains of Tyria. 

When Havoc arrived in Tyria, the Northern Dwarfholds were soon overrun. The northern Dwarves fought back even after losing their homes, and the southern Dwarves joined with the Great Alliance to protect their homes. With the Dwarven armies on campaign against Havoc, the Orcs attacked and soon conquered the Dwarfholds. The Dwarven armies were forced to return home right before the final confrontation with Havoc in order to save their families, however they were unable to defeat the Orcs who turned their own defences against them. 

The remaining Dwarves had a difficult life under the Orcs. The Orcs drove the Dwarves out of their holds and took whatever they wished from their subjects. The Dwarves held little status, reduced to performing hard labour in the fields and mines, and with their former allies too weakened to help, they lived under cruel Orc rule for generations. 

Then the Great Rift tore through the land, destroying many of the ancient holds. Many Orcs were killed by cave-ins, whilst the rest were forced to abandon the holds, leaving behind much of their armour and weapons. The Dwarves took the opportunity to rise up, using whatever weapons and tools they could find to seize back their destroyed holds. Much of their ancient wealth was lost, either buried, carried away by Orcs, or traded away long ago. Despite this, the Dwarves were determined to rebuild. 

Dwarves soon developed industries and new technologies like coal-powered Constructs and factories. Their once glorious holds laden with gold and gems are now polluted ruins, supported by steel and steam, and they venture out only to take what they need and settle old grudges. No matter what, the Dwarves will not allow their homes to fall again. 

How will you defend your hold?

gains.name: Miner Leader
gains.label: Miner Leader (Explosives (12", A3, AP(1), Limited), Infiltrate)

options.label: Miner Leader (Explosives (12", A3, AP(1), Limited), Infiltrate)

gains.name: Beast-Construct
gains.label: Beast-Construct (Heavy Claws (A1, AP(2)), Armor(3), Impact(2), Swift, Tough(3))

options.label: Beast-Construct (Heavy Claws (A1, AP(2)), Armor(3), Impact(2), Swift, Tough(3))

spells.name: Rune of Battle
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Rapid Charge once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Rune of Breaking
spells.effect: Pick one enemy model within 18", which takes 2 hits with AP(1).

spells.name: Rune of Protection
spells.effect: Pick up to four friendly units within 12", which get Sturdy Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Rune of Cleaving
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 12", which take 2 hits with AP(1) and Quake each.

spells.name: Rune of Spite
spells.effect: Pick up to six enemy units within 18", which moves -2" when using Advance actions and -4" when using Rush/Charge actions once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? this.getSpeed(unit, { advance: params.effect.advanceSpeed.value, rush: params.effect.rushSpeed.value }) : 0

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getSpeed(this.AverageUnit, { advance: params.effect.advanceSpeed.value, rush: params.effect.rushSpeed.value })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Rune of Smiting
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 18", which take 1 hit with Blast(3) each.

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Sturdy
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot or charged from over 9" away, they get +1 to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Swift
specialRules.description: This model may ignore the Slow rule.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Infiltrate
specialRules.description: Counts as having Ambush, but may be deployed up to 1" away from enemy units.

specialRules.name: Melee Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's melee weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Quake
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and on unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Swift Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Swift. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Ravage
specialRules.description: When it's this model's turn to attack in melee, roll X dice. For each 6+ the target takes one wound.

specialRules.name: Devastating Frenzy
specialRules.description: Place one marker on this unit when it fully destroys an enemy unit. For each marker all models with this rule in this unit get AP(+1) and +1 to defense rolls until the end of the game (up to a max. of +2).

specialRules.name: Precision Charge Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +1 to hit rolls when charging. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Rending in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Rending in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Relentless Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Relentless. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Resistance Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Resistance. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Sturdy Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Sturdy Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Speed Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which moves -2" when using Advance actions and -4" when using Rush/Charge actions once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Slow
specialRules.description: Moves -2" when using Advance, and -4 when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9 away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush cant seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Rending
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and on unmodified results of 6 to hit, those hits get AP(+4).

specialRules.name: Relentless
specialRules.description: When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Resistance
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored. If the wounds were from a spell, then they are ignored on a 2+ instead.

specialRules.name: Sturdy Boost
specialRules.description: If all models in this unit have Sturdy, they always get +1 to defense rolls from Sturdy (instead of only when being shot/charged from over 9" away).

specialRules.name: Blast
specialRules.description: Ignores cover, and after resolving other special rules, each hit is multiplied by X, where X is up to as many hits as enemy models in the target unit and within 3 of it. Hits must be split evenly between all enemy units within 3 of any model from the target (defender picks how).

specialRules.name: Rapid Charge
specialRules.description: This model moves +4" when using Charge actions.
